JobFullDesc: Overview Do you enjoy using your quantitative and analytical skills to find and solve big problems? Are you passionate about enabling data-based decisions to tackle strategic challenges? We are looking for someone to do just that in the context of Microsoft’s biggest asset - our people. As an analyst on the HR Business Insights Advanced Analytics and Research team, your work will enable data-driven decision making around our diversity and inclusion efforts, learning and development investments, and employee recruitment/support. In addition, you will have the opportunity to work on a range of meaningful analytical projects that will not only provide you with the platform for demonstrating your analytical, statistical and communication capabilities, but will help you to grow them. In this role you will work with fellow “learn-it-all” analysts and data scientists who are passionate about their work, and eager to engage in brainstorming sessions and other forms of close collaboration. You will engage with clients and partners in our centers of excellence and HR line units who are doing industry-leading work across the HR function. You will be supported by a team with a shared commitment to creating an inclusive work environment, where all voices are heard and valued. ResponsibilitiesResponsibilitiesOwn and support the end-to-end analytical process for people-related business questions and outcomes spanning the employee life cycleAnalytical projects will range from proactive, complex, longer term deliverables to very short-fused, reactive, quick-and-dirty insights we can provide “just-in-time” in order to impact a decision that will be made immediatelyContract with customers, partners, and co-workers to define research questions, analysis plans, and deliverable timelinesWork directly with data, from initial extraction through preliminary analysis to results validationTranslate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with partners who help you tell a holistic storyCommunicate results effectively for impact, and provide follow-up insights in a timely mannerQualificationsRequired Qualifications5+ years of experience applying analytical methods to business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomesPreferred QualificationsStrong statistical analysis skills and knowledge of statistical software (for example, SPSS or R), including the application of multivariate modelsAbility to translate business questions/needs into appropriate analytical problems, do high-quality analysis, and turn outputs into concrete, actionable business insightsComfort with ambiguous requests from management, and ability to effectively turn them into detailed work plans and contracted deliverables that meet customers’ needsStrong attention to detail and high commitment to accuracyKnowledge of diversity and inclusion concepts and programs (preferred)Masters or PhD in social sciences field (preferred)This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee within this position.
